author: babaelliot
title: PLUTUS/CATALYST RESOURCE IN SWAHILI
description: 150 million Swahili speakers in the East Africa region don't have access to education and resources which will lift them out of poverty

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is a good one and relates to the objectives of the challenge, as it seeks to bring Swahili-speakers with content related to the Cardano ecosystem. This would very well achieve what the challenge calls for, it would help in the dissemination of our technologies to non-English speakers. However, I think the proposal was explained a little superficially. Not exactly what the translated content is. We know it would be about Plutus and Cardano, but that's just the surface. What, within these matters, would be said? What topics, in what order, and why? Several fronts are promised: translation into Swahili on important sites for Cardano; creation of a news portal; of a podcast... There are many places, but not one of them is properly explained. For example: how often are the contents of pre-existing sites in school? What content would be covered in the podcast, and why? How often would the new news portal be fed, would it be local or global news? Unfortunately, it is not possible to have a good understanding of the practical part of the proposal. The issue is real and relevant, although I remember that there are no proposals with the aim of generating translations in Swahili, but there is certainly always more to be done: the question here would be to measure how this would be done, often, how would it go reach the target audience and so on. Without such data, it is difficult to define the impact both for the country and for the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team does not establish a pre-defined script to comply with pre-defined actions. We know very well what would be done, in this case, the various things. But this is different from drawing up an action plan. A timetable could be established, in which authors clarify how such translations/content creation would be done. For example, in the same week, would pre-existing content be translated and 1 new subject created in podcast and in the news portal? How would this frequency be? What subjects would be covered, in order? Who would do what to make things happen? I believe that a script should be established, not even in phases, but with the exact schedule of what would be done when and by whom. Regarding the team, this part is excellent. We know who those involved are, what their backgrounds are and what they would do in the project, and it's very positive that we have here people who are knowledgeable about the Cardano blockchain. A lot of confidence is passed on to the team in carrying out this project, and it's especially valid when they claim these translations would be done from native to native - which makes the degree of comprehension high. And about the financial division, there are details, but it could be more in-depth. The total amount is divided into topics, which gives a good understanding of how the requested money would be spent. But when I say it could be more detailed, for example: "marketing - $2200". We don't know how this money would be used in detail. It is not defined at any time how the marketing campaign would be, which would be necessary to understand the use of this money. So on for the other topics: some are quite simple and don't need as much detail, while others do. I would like to make an observation: although the funding is high, I found the translators and publisher's pay to be low, I think they deserved more for their efforts. Who knows, the requested amount could be distributed again, in order to make a fairer payment?
f6_assessments.q2: I believe this proposal is very auditable. I think this is because the authors list several goals they want to achieve - so we have a lot of content to monitor. Although success metrics and exact KPIs have not been established, it is possible to verify whether the information passed in the detailed plan session was achieved or not. I think the follow-up could be done in two ways: from the inside out or from the outside to the inside. From the inside out: the members of the team themselves could prepare reports summarizing the progress of activities, how the translations were being carried out, how the podcast was being recorded, the construction of the news page... Check data such as: audience reach , mention on social networks, audience interaction, content released per week and so on. And an outside-in analysis could also be done: how would this project be impacting the Swahili community? A survey could be carried out directly with the public, in order to understand if the objectives were achieved in practice, that is, if they think that the availability and quality of content in their local language has really been increased. It would be interesting if the inhabitants of the country itself could make a direct return to the Cardano community. But in general, I think so, this topic is well covered, it's just not perfect because KPIs and success indicators are still missing here, in a straightforward way.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal identifies a problem that Swahili speakers in the East Africa region have no available resources to access and education to provide awareness.
The proposal would build a strong foundation and connection of the Projects with the native individuals, establish local representatives, provide easily understood contents and assist to attract users and experts in the Cardano native community in this region. That will help to add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
Raising awareness for Cardano Community in Tanzania is a good goal aligned with the outlined challenge settings but the proposer need to make clear the key metrics such as: the decreased number or ratio of people scammed or quantity of users and experts attracted in the Cardano community in the East Africa Region after 12 months,...
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer provides reference links to relevant skills and experience of each member of the team but I found that no person has translation experience needed to implement the proposal but they are almost content creators with background on Financial & Forex Market and Blockchain Technology, not on Cardano in particular. Only Angela has background on Cardano (Coder, Plutus Pioneer, Member of the Eastern Town Hall Team,...) but I could not find any link for reference to this unofficial member. 
I think it would better if the proposer add some members has translation skills and experience to much more convince the feasibility of this proposal.
The budget is outlined clearly but need to break down into identifiable items, as specific as: $200 per month for a content translator need broken down into number of materials/documents with approximate words number translated and calculate its budget based on each word, breaking down the budget for marketing into number of members, how many work hours and on which channel?,...
The Authors have not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation and how to mitigate them for example: the quality of translated content not meet expectation and chosen contents not suitable to the native community, so how to control and improve translation quality and the ways to get feedback from community on what contents need feeded.
In generally, I neither agree nor disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The Author of this proposal just listed all works to do but didn't give roadmap and milestones and a time horizon for achievement. It would better if the proposer give out clear milestones and time horizon such as: Collaborating with EBU and Eastern Town Hall to translate and provide education (1st month), Creating a Webpage with articles covering current Cardano-related news (2nd month),...  
It lacks of metrics or KPIs appropriate to this challenge. It is better if the Author make details metrics/KPI such as: How many important Cardano documents translated per month, Number of EastAfrican participants join and interact in communication channel, Number of Cardano podcasts published on Swahili YouTube channel and how many views,...
By these above reasons, I don't think this proposal has good auditability for community tracking or following.

f6_assessments.q0: Haskell/Plutus developers are in much demand at the moment in the Cardano Community. There are a lot of talented people worldwide, who need basic access to learning resources in their native language. And this proposal sets up to do just that. Swahili is spoken by about 100 million people, as such it would be a very effective endeavour to have Plutus courses translated.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have described their past experience in sufficient details and their backgrounds are abundantly diverse and have the skill to finalise this project. The plan is straightforward, easy to follow and the budget is pretty sensible as well, with enough details to give the impression of a thought-out proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: While the team have put down an expected launch date and have written a roadmap for the project, there is no clear timeline and KPIs that would help the community in better evaluating the progress. I would have loved to see that written down, not just for the community, but as a step that benefits the team as well, by putting things in perspective.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem and the solution to the problem have been identified, but it is a paradox how the solution aims to solve the problem. I understand that Africa needs a lot of resources as many people have no access to education, more precisely basic education. But people who want to learn Plutus are required to have higher education, and the questions is: why people with no basic education will want to access a high level education even it will be available in Swahili?

Saying this, it is recommended that the target audience should be filtered out and find those in need for Plutus materials translated in Swahili.
f6_assessments.q1:
The members of the team (3) are presented and based on the provided info they seem to not possess the necessary skills to implement the project and there are no references (links) to sustain those statements about their experience (repositories, completed projects etc.) thus making Angela (who possesses the relevant to the project skills)  looking like a character and not like a human been.

The budget is outlined and broken down into identifiable items, but some of them are unclear about their meaning (what is the purpose of "Team Leaders Fund"?; what is the difference between "Manager for communication channel" and "Podcasts Planner and speaker"?)

Roadmap and milestones (incl. time horizon) are weakly described and there are no KPIs/metrics defined to measure the success of the project. As a side note, Expected public launch should be postponed at least after the Fund7 Campaign is over.
f6_assessments.q2:
Based on the information provided is highly unlikely that the project will be successfully implemented as the proposal lacks in emphasizing relevant aspects.

The proposal itself reads very poorly. It reads like a concept more than an executable proposal. It needs more editing so that it can be assessed properly given its direction. Perhaps reworking it and submitting it at the later stages will work.

f6_assessments.q0: The project will develop the Swahili Catalyst community by realistic solution - Collaborating with EBU and Eastern Town Hall to translate and provide education on Plutus  and catalyst resources in Swahili language.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have experience on relevant fields (content creator, speaker, developer...) and include member of the Eastern Town Hall Team, indicating they have good knowledge of Cardano and the ecosystem. Plus, the plan is very detail about what is the output of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: It would be more sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the project if the proposal includes the roadmap/ milestones with detail KPIs of each phase.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree this proposal addresses the challenge since it wants to translate Catalyst project to the Swahili language speaking community (East Africa Region - 150 million people). However, this target community is not very big compared to Japanese, Chinese or European with billions people - which need to be prioritised since Cardano has limited resources for each challenge/ fund - at this time. Therefore, I rate the impact the score of 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal has a powerful team about which I think they are totally capable of running this project. I checked out their partner's Youtube channel - RFFXTZ Company, and could tell this is a rich and professional platform for supporting this team. Development planning and timeline are convincing and clear. 
The only of my concern is that the budget for publishing the translation is three times much more than the fee for translation, makes this proposal cost $20,000 (one fifth of this challenge) while the community is just 150 millions people. This could be a big consideration for the feasibility for being voted and implemented. I advice the team to consider more about the budget so that this proposal will have high opportunity to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, while the proposal is well written about its impact and plan to make it feasible, there is no roadmap with milestones, key metrics for success and KPIs. I have to rate 2 for this proposal auditability because it doesn't provide me sufficient information to assess.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal would create resources in Swahili which addresses this challenge appropriately.
f6_assessments.q1: This team is already skilled in content creation, has experience educating about technology and is bi-lingual. This experience along with their full proposal (KPIs, project roadmap, and budget breakdown) suggest this project will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Their financial information (budget breakdown) and planning information (KPIs and project roadmap) provide sufficient information to audit the proposal's progress.
